references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 139, b(n,n-2).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (5, -10, 10, -5, 1).
formula: a(n) = (n-1)n(n+1)(3n-10)/24.If we define f(n,i,a)=sum(binomial(n,k)*stirling1(n-k,i)*product(-a-j,j=0..k-1),k=0..n-i), then a(n-1) = f(n,n-2,-1), for n>=3. [From _Milan Janjic_, Dec 20 2008]G.f.: -x^2*(1-4*x)/(1-x)^5. [Colin Barker, Mar 21 2012]a(2)=-1, a(3)=-1, a(4)=5, a(5)=25, a(6)=70, a(n)=5*a(n-1)-10*a(n-2)+ 10*a(n-3)- 5*a(n-4)+a(n-5)  From _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 05 2012
maple: with(combinat): for n from 3 to 100 do for k from n-2 to n-2 do printf(`%d,`,sum(binomial(l,k)*k^(l-k)*stirling1(n,l), l=k..n)) od: od:
mathematica: f[n_] := 3*n - 1; s1 = s2 = s3 = 0; lst = {}; Do[a = f[n]; s1 += a;s2 += s1; s3 += s2; AppendTo[lst, s3], {n, 0, 5!}]; lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jun 27 2009 *)Drop[CoefficientList[Series[-x^2 (1 - 4*x)/(1 - x)^5, {x, 0, 50}], x],2] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 22 2012 *)Rest[Table[(n - 1) n (n + 1)(3 n - 10)/24, {n, 50}]] (* or *) LinearRecurrence[ {5, -10, 10, -5, 1},{-1, -1, 5, 25, 70}, 50] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 05 2012 *)
crossrefs: Cf. similar sequences listed in A241765.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 26 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jan 26 2001
